channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Dumped Item, 1st August
item.description:
Opposite 190 Watling Street, Bexleyheath: Please could you remove a dumped shopping trolley from the grass verge behind the pavement.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): London Road, Crayford, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 3 broken slabs, all pieces rocking., 1st August
item.description:
This has been broken for a few months. Getting worse as people walk over it daily. Recently an Elderly pedestrian has tripped over and fallen on on their hips. We have tripped over numerous times

item.title: Overhanging hedge nearly completely blocking the foot path, 1st August
item.description:
The property is for sale with Edmund Estate Agents and I am uncertain whether the property is empty or not. I walk past this property virtually every day. The hedge is overhanging the path by a considerable amount. You either have to push past the vegetation or step into the road on a dangerous bend. Pushchairs or wheelchair users would find it very difficult to pass by. This really needs fixing before the schools return after the summer holidays.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Crofton Lane, Crofton, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Roadwork vehicle on private land, 1st August
item.description:
A van which looks like a council or highways vehicle with cones and other equipment is parked on private property. Its been here a few days and nobody has returned. Possibly abandoned.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Troughton Road, Charlton, London
Report on FixMyStreet
